definition: An archipelago is a group of islands
here a basin is a depression on land (seawater covered basins are found in the sea file)
a coastal land area
large landmass as recognized by cultural convention
a river delta, a landform at the mouth of a river
a landscape with little precipitation
hilly transition zone between plains and higher mountains or hills
a geographic region
a narrow and deep ravine between cliffs, a canyon
an island: land completely surrounded by water and smaller than a continent
a narrow strip of land connecting two larger land areas
a body of relatively still water located in a basin
plains which are located close to the sea level (not above ~150m)
an area with several geologically related mountains
a landform which is surrounded more than half but not completely by water
a flat geographic region (see also lowland and plateau)
a flat geographic region which is higher than the surrounding
a biome where the tree growth is hindered by low temperatures and short grow seasons
low area between hills, often with a river running through it
land area that is permanently or seasonally saturated with water
body of water connected to an ocean or lake, formed by an indentation of the shoreline
type of landform; confined river; strait
long, narrow inlet of the ocean created in a valley carved by glacial activity
large inlet that is an arm of an ocean or sea
an indentation of a shoreline that often leads to an enclosed body of salt water, such as a sound, bay, lagoon, or marsh
shallow body of water separated from larger body of water by a barrier
very large body of saline water
feature lying beneath the surface of the water
larger natural watercourse
large body of saline water
long, relatively wide body of water, connecting two larger parts of the sea
naturally formed, narrow waterway that connects two larger bodies of water
